title: Enable Google Analytics
content:
Google Analytics is a web analytics tool provided by Google that helps you to measure your website traffic and gather vital information about your website visitors. 

To enable Google Analytics for Service Management,perform the following tasks:

Note:  Although Google Analytics 4 supports Measurement ID (G-XXXXXXX), currently, this Measurement ID won’t take effect in Service Management.
  1. Before you enable Google Analytics, you need to create a Universal Analytics property for your Google Analytics account.
    See the following screenshot as an example:
  2. Once the Property is created, go to Tracking Info > Tracking Code under the Property. Mark down the Tracking ID displayed at the top of the page.
    See the following screenshot as an example:
  3. In Postman, send a POST request with the following settings:

    • URL: https://<host>:<port>/auth/authentication-endpoint/authenticate/token?TENANTID=<tenant-id>

    • Select format as JSON and add the user name and password under the Body tab. Here is an example:

      {"login":demoUser@microfocus.com,"password":"Password1"}

      Note: Be sure to use the user name of tenant admin in the Body.

  1. Click Send. Your request now should have received an authentication token under the response body. 
  2. Next, send a PUT request in Postman with the following settings:

    • URL: https://<host>:<port>/rest/<tenant-id>/common-settings/setting/GA_TRACKING_ID

    • Headers:

      • Add a Cookie header and set the value as SMAX_AUTH_TOKEN=%token% 
        Be sure to replace %token% with the authentication token you received in step 4.

      • Add a Content-Type header and set the value as application/json.

      • Body: {"value": "<GA Tracking ID>"}
        Be sure to replace <GA Tracking ID> with the Tracking ID you marked down in step 2. For example: {"value": "UA-21XXXXXX3-1"}

    Click Send.
  1. Then, send a PUT request in Postman with the following settings:

    • URL: https://<host>:<port>/rest/<tenant-id>/common-settings/setting/ENABLE_GA

    • Headers:

      • Add a Cookie header and set the value as SMAX_AUTH_TOKEN=%token%
        Be sure to replace %token% with the authentication token you received in step 4.

      • Add a Content-Type header and set the value as application/json.

      • Body: {"value": "true"}

    Click Send.
